snippet: It took months of complicated financial maneuvering at a tumultuous time in the markets to raise money for the industry’s largest takeover ever....
abstract: Dell, headed by Michael Dell, and its financial backer, investment firm Silver Lake, used so-called rolling thunder campaign to raise $67 billion in its attempt to buy tech behemoth EMC in 2015; deal, scheduled to close in late 2016, included fourth-biggest investment-grade corporate bond ever raised and involved months of complicated financial maneuvering.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: It took months of complicated financial maneuvering at a tumultuous time in the markets to raise money for the industry’s largest takeover ever.

headline.main: How Dell Raised $67 Billion for the Biggest Tech Deal Ever
headline.print_headline: How Dell Raised $67 Billion to Buy EMC in the Biggest Tech Deal Ever
